docs.title: NEXUS AI Terminal Assistant
docs.text:
Welcome to the official documentation for the NEXUS AI Terminal Assistant. This site provides comprehensive guides, references, and best practices for users and contributors.

  • Multi-model AI switching (Gemini, Groq, Ollama, HuggingFace, ChatGPT, MCP)
  • Secure by default, with input sanitization and safe command allowlist
  • Developer tools, productivity suite, analytics, games, and more

Use the navigation to explore features, installation, configuration, and advanced usage.

docs.title: Context-Aware AI
docs.text:
• /learn [topic] — Teach AI about technologies
  • /remind [task] — Set task reminders
  • /reminders — View active reminders
  • /complete-reminder [n] — Mark reminder as complete

docs.title: Analytics & Monitoring
docs.text:
• /analytics — View usage statistics
  • /error-analytics — View error analytics
  • /start-monitoring — Start system monitoring
  • /stop-monitoring — Stop system monitoring
  • /net-diag — Network diagnostics
  • /analyze-logs — Analyze log files
  • /health — System health check

docs.title: Games & Learning
docs.text:
• /challenge [difficulty] — Get coding challenge
  • /quiz [topic] — Take interactive quiz
  • /user-stats — View learning statistics

docs.title: Creative Tools
docs.text:
• /ascii [text] — Generate ASCII art
  • /colors [type] [base] — Generate color schemes
  • /music [mood] [length] — Generate music patterns
  • /story [genre] [length] — Generate creative stories

docs.title: Advanced Security
docs.text:
• /encrypt [message] — Encrypt messages
  • /decrypt [message] — Decrypt messages
  • /rotate-key [service] [key] — Rotate API keys
  • /biometric-auth [data] — Biometric authentication
  • /secure-password [len] — Generate secure passwords
  • /security-report — View security report
  • /threat-scan [text] — Scan for security threats

docs.title: User Management
docs.text:
• /setkey [provider] [key] — Set API keys
  • /history — View chat history
  • /clearhistory — Clear chat history
  • /myactivity — View activity log
  • /listusers — List all users (admin)
  • /resetpw [user] [newpass] — Reset password (admin)

docs.title: Setting Up Your Local Environment
docs.text:
1. Fork the repository
  2. Clone your fork: bash git clone https://github.com/YOUR-USERNAME/NEXUS-AI.io.git cd NEXUS-AI.io
  3. Install dependencies: bash pip install -r requirements.txt
  4. Copy .env.example to .env and set your API keys
  5. Run the application: bash python terminal/main.py

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text:
• Create a branch: git checkout -b feat/your-feature
  • Commit and push: git commit -m "feat: add your feature"
  • Open a Pull Request with a clear description and context

See CONTRIBUTING.md for more details.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Python 3.9+
  • Internet access for cloud models (Gemini, Groq, HuggingFace, ChatGPT, MCP)
  • Optional: Ollama installed and running for local models

docs.title: Option A: One-click OS scripts
docs.text:
• Windows: dist/install_windows.bat
  • macOS: dist/install_mac.sh
  • Linux: dist/install_linux.sh

Verify SHA256 checksums in dist/SHA256SUMS.txt before running installers.

docs.title: Option B: From source (recommended for development)
docs.text:
# Clone
 git clone https://github.com/KunjShah95/NEXUS-AI.io.git
 cd NEXUS-AI.io

# Install dependencies
 pip install -r requirements.txt

# Configure environment
 cp .env.example .env   # set your API keys

# Run
 python terminal/main.py

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
• Type /help to see the full command catalog
  • Switch models anytime with /switch [model]
  • Use /ollama-models to list your local Ollama models

docs.title: Core Commands
docs.text:
• /models — list available AI backends and states
  • /current-model — show the active model and description
  • /switch [model] — change model
  • /ollama-models — summary table of installed Ollama models
  • /run <safe-cmd> — run allowlisted commands
  • /sysinfo — OS, CPU, memory, disk stats
  • /websearch <query> — quick DuckDuckGo search
  • /weather <city> — current weather
  • /note <text> and /notes — quick note and list
  • /timer <seconds> — countdown with notification
  • /calc <expr> — evaluate math expressions safely
  • /convert <val> <from> <to> — quick unit conversions

docs.title: Developer Tools
docs.text:
• /review ..., /codereview <file>, /refactor <file> <instruction>
  • /todos, /gendoc <file>, /gentest <file>
  • Git: /git status, /git add, /git commit, /git log, /git diff, /git branch, /git checkout, /git repo-info, /git stats
